**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
> /kind feature
> /sig kubelet


**What happened**:
The kubelet will GC the images on the node to free space when the used space reaching the percent ot the high-threhold(90% as default), but when the containers are not just managed by kubernetes(such as managed by swarm together) and not wished to be GCed by kubelet, I found we can not close the GC function by the flag of image-gc-high-threshold.
**What you expected to happen**:
add one switch to close the function of imageGC in specific senario:
when the flag  image-gc-high-threshold is set as 0, we should not GC the images on the node, just record one warning event to kube-apiserver
Or add another switch flag to close the whole function of imageGC
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
run kubernetes with several nodes, and test with making the  inode all consumed of the nodes then the kubelet can triggle the GC to delete the oldest images on the node regardless the kind of them.
